answers.answer: honestly, i would avoid it, especially because he is already so large. You would be giving him empty calories and increasing his chances of obesity and diabetes. Would you feed a toddler or older child rice just to fill him up?It is very normal for a 4 month old to wake once or twice during the night. Some wake more frequently, and some don't wake at all.

That's a very normal schedule, and the rice cereal is dangerous in the bottle, please don't do it.  Kids can not only get the obesity and diabetes, but there is the danger of inhaling it and getting particulate pneumonia.  You have a baby, he is waking up on a normal schedule in the night, you won't have to do it much longer, just try to manage.

ps -- apparently the rice cereal doesn't even make them sleep any longer, either.  Their tummy is only so big, filling it with formula (milk) will give them protein and it will last longer in their system, than would filling it with carbs (rice).

Now that meli mentioned it, I did a little thinking back and realized that my son only just started sleeping through the *entire* night in the past six months or so, and he is almost 3.  Don't let other women's (or, usually, grandmas') bragging stories make you feel like you are somehow getting a low grade on a test.  Every child is different, some of those women are fibbing, and it makes no difference to the child's ultimate success in life.  They won't be waking up wanting a bottle when they are 20, and if they do, they can get it themself, so you are doing NOTHING WRONG to just follow along with your child's natural impulses and schedule.  :)  I'm glad you pooh poohed the dumb old (and persistent) myth about the rice cereal.  It's just a bad idea.
